intro: Impatiens bussei, commonly known as the yellow impatiens, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in humid conditions. Impatiens bussei is popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
